alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 8:57AM PST until March 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 175 is expected at the approaches to the Russian River bridge. Expect flooding of cropland on the right bank of river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PST Thursday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 10.3 feet this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 16.0 feet late tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 10.2 feet Saturday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage again late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 04/07/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM PST.
